Package de.oth.programs

Interface BlockLibProgram

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractPythonAIStateMachineProgram, ActiveFluidTestProgram, AIShortestPathProgram, AIShortestPathWorldProgram, AnimationStageProgram, AutomaticDisasterProgram, AutomaticDisasterProgram, AVL_Sample, AVL_Sample, BiomOccurenceTest, BiomOccurenceTestProgram, ChunkGenerationPerformanceTest, ChunkGenerationPerformanceTestProgram, EasyExecuteProgram, EnvironmentProgram, ExamplePythonAIStateMachineProgram, FluidProgram, FluidTest, GraphRendererProgram, GraphValidationProgram, Hash_Sample, Hash_Sample, Insertion_Sample, Insertion_Sample, Krusal_Sample, Krusal_Sample, ManualDisasterProgram, ManualDisasterProgram, MultiplayerFirstTestClientAIProgram, MultiplayerFirstTestClientProgram, MultiplayerFirstTestProgram, MultiplayerFirstTestProgram, MultiplayerFirstTestServerProgram, NPC_Pursuit_TestProgram, NPCProgram, NPCPursuitTestProgram, NPCTestProgram, OceanTestProgram, OctreeVisualization, PathRenderingTest, PathRenderingTestProgram, PigProgram, Quick_Sample, Quick_Sample, RenderDemoProgram, SampleProgram, SeededDistributionTest, SeededDistributionTestProgram, ShaderDemo, ShadowProgram, SimulationProgram, SingleBiomProgram, SoundProgram, SpellcasterTest, SurvivalProgram, TeleportationTest, TeleportationTestProgram, ThreadingProgram, UnitTestProgram, UnitTestProgram, UsableItemTest, UsableItemTestProgram, VegetationWorld, VillageProgram, VRProgram, WorldProgram, ZombieProgram
public interface BlockLibProgram
The BlockLibProgram is an Interface that can be used to write a custom behavior for the BlockLib. It can be used to add functionalities to keys and its update method is regularly called in the game loop. The SampleProgram provides an example, how such a BlockLibProgram can be utilized.
Author:
Tobias Mueller

  • Method Details

    • onGameStart

      void onGameStart()
      Gets called once, when the game starts. Can be used for initialization. Either "game.createFilledWorld()" or "game.createEmptyWorld()" has to be called here. CAREFUL! Since the world is not yet created, it can not be used to set Blocks into the world.

    • onWorldLoaded

      void onWorldLoaded()
      Gets called one time once the world is completely loaded. Can be used to set initial blocks into the world.

    • update

      void update​(float deltaTime)
      Gets called once in every render loop. It may be that during the first calls, the world is not completely loaded. This can cause problems when calling e.g. the setBlock function of the WorldInteraction. Make sure to utilize the returned boolean value, by checking if the placement of the block was successful.
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - the time that has passed since the last update call.

    • keyPressed

      void keyPressed​(int key)
      Can be used to handle input When using, please import "static org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFW.*"
      Parameters:
      key - a constant from GLFW_KEY (e.g. GLFW_KEY_A)

    • keyReleased

      void keyReleased​(int key)

    • processInput

      void processInput​(InputEvent inputEvent)
      For each input action (mouse, keyboard, ...) a event is fired and will invoke this function.
